content.body: annevk: ping on re-review for https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/6869 ?
Domenic: so to make sure I understand correctly, the remaining Window-object reuse question is about a subsequent navigation of this about:blank document, right?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: so to make sure I understand correctly, the remaining Window-object reuse question is about a subsequent navigation of this about:blank document, right?

content.body: Anyway, approved modulo that assumption and an optional nit
annevk: yes, because you can't observe the Window before this initial pseudo-load, so you can't tell whether it was reused or not.
content.formatted_body: annevk: yes, because you can't observe the Window before this initial pseudo-load, so you can't tell whether it was reused or not.

content.body: TabAtkins: https://github.com/w3c/webdriver-bidi/pull/131 seems to have a bikeshed error that looks like a bug in the CSS SPec Preprocessor deployment (maybe I should file an issue as it suggests, but also I'm not sure how much attention is paid to issues on repos in tobie's personal GH).
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: https://github.com/w3c/webdriver-bidi/pull/131 seems to have a bikeshed error that looks like a bug in the CSS SPec Preprocessor deployment (maybe I should file an issue as it suggests, but also I'm not sure how much attention is paid to issues on repos in tobie's personal GH).

content.body: Cool. Initially I was wondering if the Window would end up being replaced somewhere during the lifetime of the about:blank document (where Firefox would navigate to about:blank), but I realized that probably wasn't it.
